name: Mobile Ad Previewer
description: Every ad the Verve Foundry team builds is displayed on a demo page used internally for preview during development and also final design review. Occasionally, demo pages are given to clients for review. The old demo page design consisted of a fixed black rectangle for a screen and provided limited functionality. I designed and developed a new version which included significant improvements:
An overall better design with the Verve Foundry wordmark to reinforce branding
The ability to switch between different phone sizes to preview the responsiveness of an expandable ad
Controls to spoof location for creatives with geolocation functionality
A JavaScript layer that serves as a proxy for in-app and SDK-reliant functionality, such as geolocation requests, MRAID functionality, and reaction to scroll events

name: Biggby Animated MRAID Banner
description: This MRAID banner ad for Biggby Coffee features a fun and colorful bubble animation that peeks above the original 320x50 placement.

name: Pepsi 1893 Animated MRAID Banner
description: This MRAID banner ad for Pepsi 1893 features a scripted animation that peeks over the original 320x50 placement. The banner expands to a panel on click that includes a gallery of recipes with corresponding videos.

name: Jaguar 360-degree Exterior Experience
description: This ad unit for Jaguar features an expandable panel with a 360-degree experience that respond to a user's gestures. Swipes across the image are detected and switch the image that is being display, simulating the effect of a camera panning around the vehicle.

name: Jaguar Gyroscopic 360-degree Interior Experience
description: This expandable unit for the Jaguar XE vehicle is a true 360-degree experience that responds to device orientation events from the gyroscope in the user's mobile device. The equirectangular image provided by the client is projected within a sphere using a Verve Foundry-built 360 image and video viewer. In the event the device's orientation cannot be detected, the image can also be manipulated with touch gestures.

name: McCormick Reactive Scrolling MRAID Banner
description: This MRAID banner ad for McCormick extracts features an animation that responds to the userâ€™s scrolling off the app's content. The expanded state features a gallery with some subtle animations that is revealed after detecting a "shake" motion through device orientation data.

name: Observer.com Site Redesign
description: In late 2015, Observer.com began a sitewide redesign to transition itself from existing as an online version of a print publication to being a true online-first media company. I worked with the Brand Creative Director to transform her design specifications into a functional interface for the Observer WordPress VIP site.

name: Observer + Neiman Marcus Co-branded Ad Unit
description: Neiman Marcus collaborated with Observer for a men's fall fashion guide in mid-2016. The Brand Creative Director prepared all assets, and I developed the functioning ad unit. This "hero"-sized leaderboard was served through Google DFP and clicked out to products in addition to the sponsored article on the site. All interactions were tracked using Google Analytics.

name: Real Simple Responsive Subscription Footer
description: Most, if not all, of Time Inc.'s brands had simple ad units on their websites with CTAs that drove to subscription forms. During Real Simple's redesign, a new subscription unit was requested. This unit, which was served through Google DFP, was a full form within a footer placement on the site. I was given a flat reference image to work from that only included the layout and design for desktop. I developed the unit to spec and also made it fully responsive, since the new site was optimized for tablet and mobile devices.
